wikipedia_page.main:
Brownlow William Knox (1806 – 14 March 1873) was a British Conservative Party politician.
He was elected MP for Great Marlow in 1847 and held the seat until 1868.

response: Knox was born in Leamington Priors the son of Brownlow Knox and Louisa Sutton. He was commissioned in the Scots Fusilier Guards in January 1855 and served in the Crimean War with the Scots Fusilier Guards. He commanded the 1st Battalion of the Scots Guards during the Anglo-Egyptian War 1882. Knox was present at the Battle of Tel-el-Kebir and received a mention in despatches.
